[[Narvi|Azk√¢r]] | steed= }} '''Talion''' is a character created for the video-game ''[[Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor]]'' who served as the captain of the Rangers of Gondor on the [[Black Gate]]. He was married to a woman, named Ioreth, and he had a son with her, named Dirhael, and they were all killed by servants of [[Sauron]]. The wraith of [[Celebrimbor]] inhabited his body, making Talion unable to die and allowing both him and Celebrimbor to seek vengeance on Sauron for killing their families. He is voiced by [[Troy Baker]]. ==Etymology== [[Wiktionary:talion|Talion]] is an English word of French/[[Latin]] derivation, meaning "retaliation, retribution; punishment; an eye for an eye". ==Inspiration== The character of Talion is inspired by [[Boromir]].{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/shadow-of-mordor-has-only-scratched-the-surface-of/1100-6424332/|articlename= Shadow of Mordor Has 'Only Scratched the Surface' of Monolith's Middle-earth |dated=20 December 2014|website=[https://www.gamespot.com Gamespot]|accessed=04 January 2022}}{{webcite|author=Austin Walker|articleurl=http://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2014/10/real-human-beings-shadow-of-mordor-watch-dogs-and.html|articlename= Real Human Beings: Shadow of Mordor, Watch Dogs |dated=10 October 2014|website=[http://www.pastemagazine.com/ Pastemagazine]|accessed=04 January 2022}} {{references}} [[Category:Men from adaptations]] [[Category:Middle-earth: Shadow (video game series) characters]]
